nvinced me of the value of

 only way for you to be

upplied

wo=
rking.

exp=
ected to be used.  I've been burned too often by Documentation that
is out =
of date or inaccurate or incomplete. Very often, the
documentation doesn't =
have full examples of calling every public API.
Executable unit tests HAVE =
to be up to date.... or reveal that the
vendor is not running its own unit =
tests.
3. Unit test sources can also be examples of how the code-under-test=

behaves in failure situations. "hmm... this test shows that the file it
op=
ens has to have write-access. That's why my code, which is trying to
open a=
 file on a CD-ROM, is failing." MUCH nicer to have a supplied unit
test

 (C++) were a really good class framework available

+ that came with sources (of necessity, since

nd with unit tests. The unit tests gave you

mpiler you were using was able to

ents. Rogue Wave bought and

hem any more. They were a
